'''Stephen Dillane''' (born 30 November 1956) is a British actor experienced with roles on both stage and screen. He is arguably best known for his Emmy-nominated performance as [[wikipedia:Thomas Jefferson|Thomas Jefferson]] in the [[HBO]] mini-series ''[[wikipedia:John Adams (miniseries)|John Adams]]''. He has also appeared as [[wikipedia:Leonard Woolf|Leonard Woolf]] inÂ ''[[wikipedia:The Hours|The Hours]]'', [[wikipedia:Merlin|Merlin]] in ''[[wikipedia:King Arthur|King Arthur]]'' and [[wikipedia:Horatio (Hamlet)|Horatio]]Â in the [[wikipedia:Mel Gibson|Mel Gibson]]-starring version of ''[[wikipedia:Hamlet (1990 film)|Hamlet]]''.

His son, actor Frank Dillane, portrays the teenage [[wikipedia:Lord Voldemort|Lord Voldemort]] in the film adaptation of ''[[wikipedia:Harry Potter and the Half-Blood Prince (film)|Harry Potter and the Half-Blood Prince]]''.

In ''[[Game of Thrones]]'' Dillane is playing the role of [[Stannis Baratheon]]. He was announced in the role on 19 July 2011 and is part of the starring castÂ for the [[Season 2|second]], [[Season 3|third]],Â [[Season 4|fourth]], and [[Season 5|fifth]] seasons.
